channel.title: Business News
channel.description: Latest headlines for business news around the world.

item.title: The big management mistake AT&T made after acquisition, according to former Time Warner CEO
item.description: Time Warner made the AT&T deal to reach its 100 million-plus customers, not to be micromanaged, but that's what happened, says former Warner boss Jeff Bewkes.

item.title: Sen. Elizabeth Warren calls on SEC to investigate Trump SPAC deal
item.description: Warren cited reports that Digital World Acquisition Corp., which plans to merge with Trump's social media company, may have committed securities violations.

item.title: Here's where Tesla and other EVs ranked in this year's Consumer Reports reliability survey
item.description: Lexus, Mazda and Toyota topped the 2021 Consumer Reports Auto Reliability Report, while Jeep, Tesla, and Lincoln ranked in the bottom three.

item.title: CVS to close about 900 stores over next three years, as it shifts to digital strategy
item.description: The drugstore chain said it will focus more of its efforts on digital growth and turning its stores into health-care destinations.

item.title: Biden administration buys 10 million courses of Pfizer Covid treatment pill
item.description: "My administration is making the necessary preparations now to ensure these treatments will be easily accessible and free," President Joe Biden said in a statement.

item.title: The delta Covid mutation is spreading in the UK, but may be less likely to cause symptoms
item.description: The delta subvariant recently identified in the U.K. is now twice as prevalent in England as it was two months ago, a government-backed study has found.

item.title: Macy's plans to announce 10 store closures in January while delaying other closures
item.description: The department store chain said it would provide additional details about the locations in the near future.

item.title: Ford partners with GlobalFoundries to increase chip supplies
item.description: The companies on Thursday announced the signing of a nonbinding agreement for a strategic partnership that aims to increase the supply of chips to Ford.

item.title: 5 things to know before the stock market opens Thursday
item.description: U.S. stock futures rose slightly after the government's before-the-bell jobless claims data.

item.title: Biden's vaccine mandate will likely go to the Supreme Court. Here's how the courts have ruled before
item.description: The vaccination rules are "unprecedented in scope," but are built on an extensive framework of legal public health and safety regulations, an expert told CNBC.

item.title: Stocks making the biggest moves premarket: Alibaba, JD.com, Cisco, Nvidia and more
item.description: These are the stocks posting the largest moves before the bell.

item.title: Fund manager explains why he's still short Tesla, Ark ETF and Facebook
item.description: David Neuhauser has defended his short positions in Tesla, Facebook and Cathie Wood's Ark Innovation ETF, arguing that all could be vulnerable in a downturn.

item.title: Kohl's shares jump after retailer reports 16% sales increase as shoppers buy clothes and makeup
item.description: The department store chain also raised its forecast for the year.

item.title: Macy's shares surge on upbeat earnings, decision to hire AlixPartners to review business
item.description: Macy's reported third-quarter earnings and sales that topped analysts' expectations, leading the department store chain to raise its full-year forecast.

item.title: Airbus smashes orders at Dubai Air Show, Boeing trails behind despite big 737 Max sale
item.description: The aircraft order numbers so far from the first major air show since the Covid-19 pandemic began are a positive sign for aviation and travel.

item.title: AstraZeneca's antibody drug over 80% effective at preventing Covid, trial shows
item.description: AstraZeneca's antibody treatment has been shown to be highly effective at preventing Covid in people who may not respond well to vaccines.

item.title: Starbucks and Amazon are opening cashierless coffee shop in Manhattan. Take a look inside
item.description: Starbucks is opening a pick-up cafe in midtown Manhattan with Amazon that uses the retail giant's cashierless technology.

item.title: Record high cases, more rules and partial lockdowns: A new Covid wave engulfs Europe
item.description: The latest wave of Covid cases is hitting Europe with a vengeance.

item.title: Belgium announces new Covid restrictions, but prime minister vows to avoid lockdown
item.description: Belgium is toughening up social restrictions as Covid-19 cases surge, but Prime Minister Alexander de Croo tells CNBC the aim is still to keep society open.

item.title: Cramer's lightning round: I prefer Union Pacific over CSX
item.description: "Mad Money" host Jim Cramer rings the lightning round bell, which means he's giving his answers to callers' stock questions at rapid speed.

item.title: Cramer's advice on Lucid and Rivian: Heed lessons from the dot-com bubble and take profits
item.description: "You're playing momentum, not car companies and not technology, and in that case it's better to ring the register early and often," the "Mad Money" host said.

item.title: Here's why identity software firm Okta plans to open a retail location in New York City
item.description: "One of the challenges with identity technology and talking about this vision is sometimes it's hard to imagine," Okta co-founder and CEO Todd McKinnon said.

item.title: Flood-ravaged British Columbia declares state of emergency
item.description: The flood conditions have cut off transportation routes between the lower mainland of B.C. and the province's interior and left thousands of people stranded.

item.title: Elon Musk says SpaceX will 'hopefully' launch first orbital Starship flight in January
item.description: Elon Musk on Wednesday said that SpaceX is "hoping" to launch the first orbital flight test of its mammoth Starship rocket in January.

item.title: Jim Cramer says he’s looking to buy Walmart shares to take advantage of retailer’s post-earnings dip
item.description: After selling some Walmart at higher levels, CNBC's Jim Cramer said he's "itching to buy some of that stock back because I believe in Walmart's strategy."

item.title: CEO of Covid antibody maker Vir Biotech says its treatment 'stands up well' to all variants
item.description: A monoclonal antibody Covid treatment from Vir Biotechnology and GlaxoSmithKline "stands up well" to all variants of the virus, Vir's president and CEO said.

item.title: House lawmakers urge Labor secretary to speed truck driver training program to ease supply chain bottlenecks
item.description: They want Labor Secretary Marty Walsh to fast-track the training of dislocated workers, low-income individuals and unemployed youth.

item.title: Lowe's sees sales growth by helping baby boomers stay in their homes
item.description: The home improvement retailer said it will become a "one-stop shop" for items like grab bars and walk-in bathtubs.

item.title: Retirees are ‘unretiring’ — and that’s good for the labor market
item.description: Many older Americans retired during the Covid pandemic. Whether they will return has been an open question.

item.title: Walmart and Target clash with investors over strategy to keep prices low despite inflation
item.description: Investors are at odds with the discounters over how much of the higher costs of shipping, labor and more should be passed on to customers.
